description: Verify that the edit test plan page loads correctly with proper authentication and existing data
scenario: Admin user navigates to edit an existing test plan using the edit functionality
expected_results: Display the edit test plan form with all fields pre-populated from existing test plan data
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to test plans list
3. Click edit button for an existing test plan
4. Verify page loads at /admin/system-test/test-plans/{id}/edit
5. Check header shows 'Edit Test Plan' with existing test plan number
6. Verify all form fields are pre-populated with existing data

description: Verify that non-admin users cannot access the edit test plan functionality
scenario: Regular user attempts to access edit test plan functionality directly
expected_results: Access should be denied with 403 Forbidden error for non-admin users
procedure:
1. Log in as regular user (non-admin)
2. Attempt to navigate to /admin/system-test/test-plans/1/edit
3. Verify 403 Forbidden error is returned
4. Check redirect to appropriate error page
5. Ensure no test plan editing form is accessible

description: Verify proper error handling when attempting to edit a non-existent test plan
scenario: Admin attempts to edit a test plan that doesn't exist in the system
expected_results: Display 404 Not Found error when test plan ID doesn't exist
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to /admin/system-test/test-plans/99999/edit (non-existent ID)
3. Verify 404 Not Found error is returned
4. Check appropriate error page is displayed
5. Ensure no form is rendered for invalid test plan ID

description: Verify the page header displays correct edit context with test plan number
scenario: Admin views edit page header to understand which test plan is being edited
expected_results: Display header with 'Edit Test Plan' title and current test plan number in description
procedure:
1. Navigate to edit page for test plan STP-001-01
2. Check title shows 'Edit Test Plan'
3. Verify description shows 'Editing test plan: STP-001-01'
4. Confirm 'Back to List' button navigates to test plans list
5. Check proper styling and fade-in animation

description: Verify that all form fields are correctly pre-populated with existing test plan data
scenario: Admin views edit form to see current test plan values before making changes
expected_results: All form fields display current values from the database for the selected test plan
procedure:
1. Create a test plan with known values
2. Navigate to edit that test plan
3. Verify test_plan_no field shows existing value
4. Check module_name field shows existing value
5. Confirm all other fields (description, scenario, expected_results, procedure) show existing data
6. Verify dropdown selections match existing status, priority, and category

description: Verify that dropdown fields show correct selected values for existing test plan
scenario: Admin views configuration dropdowns to see current test plan settings
expected_results: Test status, priority, and category dropdowns show currently selected values
procedure:
1. Edit a test plan with status='passed', priority='high', category='security'
2. Verify test status dropdown shows 'passed' as selected
3. Check priority dropdown shows 'high' as selected
4. Confirm category dropdown shows 'security' as selected
5. Verify other options remain available for selection

description: Verify that the Execute Test button is available when editing existing test plans
scenario: Admin views edit form and has option to execute the test plan being edited
expected_results: Display Execute Test button in form actions when editing existing test plan
procedure:
1. Navigate to edit page for existing test plan
2. Locate form actions section at bottom
3. Verify 'Execute Test' button is present with green styling
4. Check button links to execute_test_plan route with correct test_plan_id
5. Confirm play-circle icon is displayed

description: Verify that form submission correctly updates existing test plan data
scenario: Admin modifies test plan fields and submits to save changes
expected_results: Form submission updates test plan in database and redirects to test plan view page
procedure:
1. Navigate to edit page for existing test plan
2. Modify description field and other values
3. Submit form using 'Update Test Plan' button
4. Verify POST request to /admin/system-test/test-plans/{id}/edit
5. Check test plan is updated in database
6. Confirm redirect to test plan view page with success message

description: Verify that the submit button shows 'Update Test Plan' instead of 'Create Test Plan'
scenario: Admin views form actions to understand available operations
expected_results: Submit button displays 'Update Test Plan' text when editing existing test plan
procedure:

2. Locate submit button in form actions
3. Verify button text shows 'Update Test Plan'
4. Check save icon is displayed with button
5. Confirm button styling matches create form

description: Verify that required field validation works correctly when updating test plans
scenario: Admin attempts to update test plan with missing required information
expected_results: Form validation prevents update when required fields are empty
procedure:

2. Clear required fields (test_plan_no, module_name, description, expected_results, procedure)
3. Attempt to submit form
4. Verify validation prevents submission
5. Check required fields are highlighted with red borders

description: Verify that successful update redirects to test plan view page instead of list

expected_results: Successful update redirects to view_test_plan page showing updated information
procedure:
1. Edit test plan with valid changes
2. Submit form successfully
3. Verify redirect goes to /admin/system-test/test-plans/{id} (view page)
4. Check that updated information is displayed
5. Confirm success flash message is shown

description: Verify proper error handling when update operation fails

2. Submit valid form data
3. Verify error flash message is displayed
4. Check that form data is preserved after error
5. Confirm error is logged on server side
